quizTitle: Computer Networks Quiz - Unit 1: Introduction & Physical Layer

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a type of network that covers a small geographical area like a building?
Which type of network spans a city and connects multiple LANs?
A network that connects devices over a large geographical area, often using public transmission systems, is called:
Which topology has a single central cable to which all nodes are connected?
In which topology does each device connect to every other device in the network?
Failure of the central hub leads to network breakdown in which topology?
How many layers are there in the OSI reference model?
Which OSI layer is responsible for end-to-end communication and reliability?
The data link layer is responsible for:
The TCP/IP model consists of how many layers?
Which layer of TCP/IP model corresponds to the Transport layer of OSI model?
Which of the following is TRUE about OSI and TCP/IP models?
options: OSI has 4 layers and TCP/IP has 7 layers
TCP/IP is conceptual, OSI is practical
OSI separates presentation and session layers, TCP/IP combines them in application layer
questions.correctAnswer: OSI separates presentation and session layers, TCP/IP combines them in application layer

questions.questionText: Which layer is responsible for transmission of raw bits over a physical medium?
Which of the following is a guided transmission medium?
Twisted-pair cables are mainly used for:
Which cable provides the highest bandwidth and least signal loss?
Unguided media transmit signals through:
Which of the following is an example of unguided transmission?
Which of these tasks is NOT performed by the physical layer?
Which statement correctly describes OSI vs TCP/IP?
options: OSI model was developed before TCP/IP model
TCP/IP is theoretical while OSI is practical
TCP/IP combines the OSI’s session and presentation layers into one
OSI model uses fewer layers than TCP/IP
questions.correctAnswer: TCP/IP combines the OSI’s session and presentation layers into one
